intro: Haussknechtia, commonly known as the common rockrose, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, often hairy leaves and showy, brightly colored flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plants are native to temperate regions of the northern hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. They are often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Haussknechtia species are generally low-growing shrubs, with some varieties reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
